post.description: Registers customers in the org’s loyalty program with the primary identifier (mobile number/email id/external id).

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The data format for request and response.

parameters.name: rawSideEffects
parameters.description: Pass true to get complete details of incentives such as awardOn, expiryDate, strategyIds and so on. See rawSideEffects in response for more details.

parameters.name: mlp_single_enroll
parameters.description: Pass true to enroll a customer in all the loyalty programs available for the org. Pass false to enroll in a specific program or the default program of the till.

parameters.name: USER-CONTEXT-ENTITY-TYPE
parameters.description: If required, add entity information of the user who is adding or updating this info.

parameters.name: USER-CONTEXT-ENTITY-ID
parameters.description: Enter user ID

parameters.name: USER-CONTEXT-ENTITY-SOURCE
parameters.description: Enter user source.

parameters.name: USER-CONTEXT-ENTITY-SOURCE-ID
parameters.description: Enter user source ID.

root.description: You must provide at least one of the identifier parameters (email/id/ mobile number).

points_redeemed.description: Points to be redeemed from the customer.

customer.description: Mobile number is a mandatory field.

message.example: Customer registration successful, Provided Custom Field is invalid

oneOf.title: With alternate currency as side effect

message.example: Customer registration successful, Provided Custom Field is invalid
All requests have failed due to errors

put.description: Let's you update the details of an existing customer other than primary or secondary identifiers. If any of the identifiers you pass already exists for a different account, then the customer details will be merged automatically.

root.description: You must provide at least one of the identifier parameters (email/id/ mobile number).

customer.description: Customer details. you must provide at least one of the identifier parameters (email/id/ mobile number).

X-CAP-DIRECT-REPLAY.description: Pass true to add the customer but enable loyalty events to be executed at a later point of time. The events will be pushed to queue and will be executed in near real-time.

USER-CONTEXT-ENTITY-TYPE.description: If required, add entity information of the user who is adding or updating this info.

post.description: Lets you submit request to update primary and secondary identifiers (mobile no./email id/external id) of a loyalty customer. Requests submitted through `customer/update_identity` will be in pending state by default. Capillary back-end team verifies the requests and process it accordingly.

item_status.message: Customer identity change request added successfully

message.example: Customer Identity change request added successfully

get.description: Lets you fetch customers based on partial or complete keywords passed. You can fetch customers by name, customer identifier, registered store id, registered date, loyalty points, lifetime points, lifetime purchases amount, current tier, transaction amount, and custom field values.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Preferred response format.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Query string by which customers need to be fetched. q=({param}:{Operator}:{value})
Use Query Grammar.

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific loyalty customer such as loyalty information, subscription status, 10 recent transactions, active coupons, recent store interactions, custom fields, extended fields, and customer’s unique id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique user ID of the customer.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email of the customer

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: External ID of the customer.

parameters.name: coupon_limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of coupon interactions (issued,redeemed and expired). Example: coupon_limit=5 retrieves five recent coupon interactions.

parameters.name: coupon_offset
parameters.description: Retrieves next set of coupons according to issual sequence. For example, if 10 coupons are issued to a customer till date, then coupon_offset=6, returns the 7th, 8th, 9th, and 10th coupon (ignoring the first 6 coupons).

parameters.name: coupon_order_by
parameters.description: On what basis coupon history need to order.

parameters.name: coupon_sort_order
parameters.description: Orders coupons in ascending or descending order based on the coupon_order_by value

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Pass `true` to fetch unique ID of the customer.

parameters.name: next_slab
parameters.description: Pass `true` to get the details of the next loyalty tier of the customer such as next_slab, next_slab_serial_number, next_slab_description, trackers value (for tracker based strategy), and current_nps_status.

parameters.name: slab_history
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the details of loyalty tier changes of the customer.

parameters.name: registered_store
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the store at which the customer is registered. This is returned by default.

parameters.name: registered_till
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the store-TILL at which the customer is registered. This is returned by default.

parameters.name: fraud_details
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the fraud details of a customer. This field is returned by default.

parameters.name: ndnc_status
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the status of the customer’s registered mobile number on NDNC/DND.

parameters.name: optin_status
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the services (SMS/email) to which the customer has opted in and opted out.

parameters.name: expiry_schedule
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the details of points expiry summary with number of points to expire, program ID, and date and time of expiry.

parameters.name: expired_points
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the details of expired points of the customer.

parameters.name: points_summary
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the history of points issued and redeemed

parameters.name: promotion_points
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the history of promotional points issued and redeemed. It also shows the store that issued the points and expiry date for each set of points issued. You can get up to 1000 results (maximum limit).

parameters.name: membership_retention_criteria
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the criteria set for membership or tier retention (usually for membership based loyalty program).

parameters.name: tier_upgrade_criteria
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the tier upgrade criteria configured in tier_update_criteria object of response payload. This is supported only if the tier upgrade strategy is based on Lifetime Points, Lifetime Purchases, or Current Points, but not on tracker based strategy. Also, you will not see upgrade criteria if the customer is in the highest tier.

parameters.name: mlp
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return loyalty information of the customer for each loyalty program including the gap to upgrade and gap to renew details. Different program details are applicable only for brands with multiple loyalty programs (MLP).

parameters.name: gap_to_upgrade_for
parameters.description: See the gap after a specific number of days from the current day. Gap is the value of the tier upgrade parameter (purchases/points/tracker) yet to allocate to upgrade the customer’s current tier. Pass 0 to get the gap as of the current day, 1 to get the gap as of the next day, 30 to get the gap as of the 30th day from the current day. The gap might change with days for tracker value based tier upgrade strategy. No negative values are supported.

parameters.name: gap_to_renew_for
parameters.description: See the gap after a specific number of days from the current day. The required value of purchases/visits/points/tracker to renew the tier (as per the configuration in tier downgrade strategy). Pass 0 to get the renewal value as of the current day, 1 to get renewal value as of the next day, 30 to get the renewal value as of the 30th day from the current day. No negative value is supported.

parameters.name: user_group
parameters.description: Pass `true` to retrieve the details of user group associated to the user (if available).

parameters.name: customer_image
parameters.description: Pass `true` to retrieve the customer’s profile image

parameters.name: transactions
parameters.description: Pass `true` to retrieve transactions of the customer.

parameters.name: subscriptions
parameters.description: Pass `true` to retrieve the subscription details of the customer.

parameters.name: segments
parameters.description: Pass `true` to retrieve the segment details of the customer if applicable. Segments are logical grouping of customers based on one or more parameters.

parameters.name: member_care_access
parameters.description: Pass `true` for admin users, it will show customers that are active within the vicinity of that user.

parameters.name: card_details
parameters.description: Pass `true` to retrieve  the details of all cards of the customer.

parameters.name: tracker_info
parameters.description: Pass `true` to retrieve loyalty tracker information of the customer.

parameters.name: delayed_accrual
parameters.description: Pass `true` to retrieve the customer's promised points and conversion details.

parameters.name: coupon_active
parameters.description: Pass `true` to retrieve all active coupons of the customer.

parameters.name: program_id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the loyalty program to fetch loyalty details of the customer for that particular program.

parameters.name: coupon_offer
parameters.description: Unique ID of the coupon series (offer) to include offer details of the customer.

parameters.name: store_code
parameters.description: Code of the store

parameters.name: till_code
parameters.description: Till code

parameters.name: coupon_org_entity_type
parameters.description: Entity type of the coupon series.

parameters.name: coupon_org_entity_value
parameters.description: Value of the specified coupon entity type.

parameters.name: coupon_status
parameters.description: Get customer coupons of specific status. This is similar to get customer/coupons

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Specify the ISO language code to get transaction level extended field details in your preferred language (other than English). For example, zh for Chinese, id for Indonesian, ar for Arabic.

parameters.name: program_summary
parameters.description: Set to true to fetch the active loyalty program details for the customer.

code-samples.name: Retrieve details of customer in bulk

get.description:
Retrieves transaction history of a customer which includes the following information. Transaction type, gross transaction amount, transaction date, points issued, points redeemed, coupons redeemed and so on.

By default, it shows up to 10 results and shows results based on the `limit` passed.

* There is no upper limit for number of transactions.
* There is no duration based limit.

parameters.name: identifierName
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer to use.

parameters.name: identifierValue
parameters.description:
Value of the specified identifier type. o retrieve transactions of multiple customers at a time, provide each identifier separating by a comma.
Example: `mobile=44700900000,44700900999,4470090345`

parameters.name: entity_type
parameters.description:
Attribute by which you want to filter the transactions.
For oAuth2, you need to pass this in headers. See the Introduction > Authentication section for more details.

parameters.name: entity_code
parameters.description: Code of the specified entity_type. For example, to get transactions of a specific zone (with zone code zone01), pass entity_type=zone&entity_code=zone01.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: Fetch transaction details by transaction number.

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: Fetch details of a transaction by transaction ID (internally generated unique ID for a transaction).

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: Filter transactions associated to a specific store ID.

parameters.name: store_code
parameters.description: Filter transactions made in a specific store. Pass the store code.

parameters.name: start_id
parameters.description: Filters transactions with transaction IDs are greater than or equal to a specific value.

parameters.name: end_id
parameters.description: Filter transactions with transaction IDs less than or equal to a specific value.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Retrieves transactions made on or after a specific date (YYYY-MM-DD). To get transactions of a particular duration, use both start_date and end_date.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Retrieves transactions made on or before a specific date (YYYY-MM-DD). To get transactions of a particular duration, use both start_date and end_date. Example: start_date=2013-12-21+23:45:45&end_date=2013-12-29+12:11:45

parameters.name: credit_notes
parameters.description: Retrieves the credit notes of the transactions. Credit Notes is a receipt given by a cashier to a customer for returned goods which can be used for future purchases.

parameters.name: custom_fields
parameters.description: Pass true to retrieve transaction level custom field details.

parameters.name: points_breakup
parameters.description: Pass true to retrieve the breakup of points earned for each transaction.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results to be displayed (default value is 10). For example, limit=20 shows up to 20 transactions of the customer.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to be ignored from the top. Offset is the position of the entity in the database record. The value is assigned based on the sequence of creation. For example, offset=10 ignores the first 10 transactions of the customer.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Whether to sort results by transaction date or transaction ID.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Arranges the transactions based on the value set in sort. By default, results are shown in the descending order of transaction date/id.

parameters.name: mlp
parameters.description: Pass `true` to get transactions from all programs of the org, `false` to fetch from the default program associated with the till.

get.description: This API allows you to retrieve points and coupons redemption history of a customer. You can filter the results by type, duration, coupon ids start with, and coupon ids end with. Besides filters you can also sort the results by ascending or descending order by redemption id/time and limit number of results to retrieve.

parameters.name: identifierName
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer to use.

parameters.name: identifierValue
parameters.description:
Value of the specified identifier type. o retrieve transactions of multiple customers at a time, provide each identifier separating by a comma.
Example: `mobile=44700900000,44700900999,4470090345`

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of redemption.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Retrieves redemptions made on or after a specific date (YYYY-MM-DD). To get transactions of a particular duration, use both start_date and end_date.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Retrieves redemptions made on or before a specific date (YYYY-MM-DD). To get transactions of a particular duration, use both start_date and end_date. Example: start_date=2013-12-21+23:45:45&end_date=2013-12-29+12:11:45

parameters.name: entity_code
parameters.description: Code of the specified entity_type. For example, to get transactions of a specific zone (with zone code zone01), pass entity_type=zone&entity_code=zone01.

parameters.name: coupons_limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of coupon redemptions to be displayed. Example:coupons_limit=10 to show only 10 coupon redemption details. Use only when the type parameter is not passed.

parameters.name: points_limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of points redemption results to be displayed. Example:points_limit=10 to show only 10 points redemption details. Use only when the type parameter is not passed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of redemption details (points and/or coupons). Use only when the type parameter is not passed. Default value is 10.

parameters.name: coupons_start_id
parameters.description: Filter the results by coupon redemption id starting with a specific number. Use only when the type parameter is not passed.

parameters.name: coupons_end_id
parameters.description: Filter the results by coupon redemption id ending with a specific number. Use only when the type parameter is not passed.

parameters.name: points_start_id
parameters.description: Filter the results by points redemption id ending with a specific number. Use only when the type parameter is not passed.

parameters.name: points_end_id
parameters.description: Retrieves the credit notes of the transactions. Credit Notes is a receipt given by a cashier to a customer for returned goods which can be used for future purchases.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the results either by redemption id or redeemed time. By default, the results are sorted in the descending order of redeemed time.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order the results in ascending (asc) or descending order (desc). By default, the results are shown in the descending order of redeemed time.

parameters.name: mlp
parameters.description: Pass `true` to get redemptions of the customer from all programs of the org, `false` to fetch from the default program associated with the till.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Representation of response content.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Pass `true` to return the customer ID in response. By default, customer id is not retrieved.

parameters.name: merchant_store_id
parameters.description: Pass the merchant store ID of to fetch redemptions made in that particular merchant store.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Arranges the transactions based on the value set in sort. By default, results are shown in the descending order of transaction date/id.

parameters.name: program_id
parameters.description: Pass program ID to filter redemptions of a particular program.

parameters.name: issuedToIds
parameters.description: Pass the customer id that you want to retrieve the coupon details from.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Pass the coupon code that you want to retrieve. To retrieve details of multiple coupons, pass each code separating with , (comma).

parameters.name: coupon_code_case
parameters.description: This parameter helps to retrieve the coupon code in the desired letter cases. By default, the system automatically converts the coupon code to upper case. The query itself is not case sensitive. Supported Values: LOWER: Converts the coupon code to lower case. UPPER: Converts the coupon codes to upper case. AS_IT_IS: It ensure that the coupon code is retrieved exactly as it was created or provided, without altering the letter case. For instance, if the code is "abAB123," it should be retrieved and displayed as "abAB123," maintaining its original formatting.

get.description: Retrieves the details of coupons (issued, redeemed, expired) of a specific customer.

parameters.name: mobile
parameters.description: Mobile number of the customer.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email ID of the customer.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: External ID of the customer.

parameters.description: Unique ID of the customer.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Get coupons issued or redeemed on or after a specific date (YYYY-MM-DD). To get coupon history of a specific duration, pass the date range in start_date and end_date.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Get coupons issued or redeemed before a specific date (YYYY-MM-DD). To get coupon history of a specific duration, pass the date range in start_date and end_date.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Retrieve coupons by coupon status. active is based on the coupon expiry date and does not validate redemptions. Hence you will see all coupons whose expiry (valid_till) is a future date.

parameters.name: series_id
parameters.description: Retrieve details of a specific coupon series by series id.

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: Retrieves the details of active coupons of the customer that can be redeemed at a specific store.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: "valid_till" is used to filter coupons by their validity. Use "sort_order" alongside this to sort the results in ascending or descending order of coupon validity.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Sort the results in ascending (asc) or descending (desc) order of order_by.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results to be retrieved. For example: limit=10 to retrieve the history of ten recent coupons of the customer.

parameters.name: mobile
parameters.description: Mobile number of the customer.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email ID of the customer.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the customer.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: External ID of the customer.

parameters.name: card_number
parameters.description: Card number of the customer.

parameters.name: card_external_id
parameters.description: Card external ID of the customer.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Coupon code to validate.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Pass `true` to retrieve the details of the coupon series, `extended` to retrieve the details of coupon configurations (set on campaign) of that specific coupon series.

parameters.name: coupon_code_case
parameters.description: This parameter helps to retrieve the coupon code in the desired letter cases. By default, the system automatically converts the coupon code to upper case. The query itself is not case sensitive. Supported Values: LOWER: Converts the coupon code to lower case. UPPER: Converts the coupon codes to upper case. AS_IT_IS: It ensure that the coupon code is retrieved exactly as it was created or provided, without altering the letter case. For instance, if the code is "abAB123," it should be retrieved and displayed as "abAB123," maintaining its original formatting.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the specific coupon series that you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: expired
parameters.description: Retrieves the details of the expired coupon series if expired=true and active coupon series details if expired=false. To also include coupon configuration details, pass expired=extended.

get.description: Retrieve products available at the current org based on the query params such as SKU, quantity, price, item status, images, attributes and so on.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Query string - URL encoded string containing the parameters to be used for searching. Multiple parameters can be passed in the “attribute:OPERATOR:value” with fixed operators and separated by '|' character.
To search for a product of color black or blue or green, size XL, price between 2000 & 4000 and department Men's, the search query would like -
q=(color:IN:Black;Blue;Green|size:EQUALS:XL|price:RANGE:2000;4000|department:EQUALS:Men)
Urlencoded string = color%3AIN%3ABlack%3BBlue%3BGreen%7Csize%3AEQUALS%3AXL%7Cprice%3ARANGE%3A2000%3B4000%7Cdepartment%3AEQUALS%3AMen
